activities.loc: Br 10 - Law Enforcement Center - West Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ulysses V Oates

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:38 AM Defendant Ulysses V Oates in court.  Attorney Pamela Popken in court for Ulysses V Oates.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 

Defense requests adjournment defendant is in the lobby ill.
BTC: Matter adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:30 AM Defendant Ulysses V Oates in court.  Attorney Pamela Popken in court for Ulysses V Oates.  Attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Matter set for plea/sentencing. 
Defense needs to renegotiate and requests a status date. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim S.M.L (person, property, residence or family).

AMENDED 8/12/2022 to allow contact with S.M.L. through electronic communication

9:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ulysses V Oates in court, in custody.  Attorney Pamela Popken in court for Ulysses V Oates. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. Victim appears via zoom. 
Matter set to address Defense's motion to modify monetary condition as well as no contact. 
Defense gives further statement as to request as outlined in motion. 
State objects and gives statement as to why. 
Court asks victim questions about request to modify no contact. 

BTC: BOND MODIFICATION: Court will not reduce the amount for the bond but will modify the no contact to allow telephone/video contact only.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.

BTC: Matter set over.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

8:44 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ulysses V Oates in court, in custody.  Attorney Pamela Popken in court for Ulysses V Oates. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Matter set to address Defense's motion to modify bond. 
Defense gives further statement as to request to modify bond as outlined in their motion. 
State objects to bond. 
BTC: BOND MODIFICATION: Denied.
